multipathaic 0.1.0

    • Multi-Path AIC Selection: Diabetes Progression Analysis

Multi-Path Forward Selection Using AIC

Source: R/multipathaic.R
build_paths.Rd

Implements a branching forward-selection algorithm using AIC for either linear (`gaussian`) or logistic (`binomial`) regression models.

At each step, every current parent model attempts to add every unused predictor, producing a set of children models. Children are kept if they: (1) improve AIC relative to the parent by at least `eps`, and (2) lie within `delta` of the best child AIC for that parent.

Duplicate models are merged, and if more than `L` children remain, only the `L` best (lowest AIC) models are kept. The process continues for up to `K` steps or until no parent improves AIC.

build_paths(
  X,
  y,
  family = c("gaussian", "binomial"),
  K = min(ncol(X), 10),
  eps = 1e-06,
  delta = 2,
  L = 100,
  weights = NULL,
  verbose = TRUE
)

Arguments

X

A data frame or matrix of predictors. All predictors must be numeric or convertible to numeric.

y

A numeric response vector. For `family = "binomial"`, must be 0/1.

family

Character string: either `"gaussian"` (linear regression) or `"binomial"` (logistic regression).

K

Integer. Maximum number of forward-selection steps to explore. Default: min(ncol(X), 10).

eps

Minimum AIC improvement required for a child model to be considered an improvement over its parent. Default: `1e-6`.

delta

AIC tolerance for keeping near-best children at each step. Children with AIC <= (best child AIC + delta) are retained. Default: 2.

L

Maximum number of child models retained at each step after deduplication. Helps limit tree size. Default: 100.

weights

Optional numeric vector of observation weights for the underlying `lm()` or `glm()` fits.

verbose

Logical. If TRUE (default), prints detailed information about each selection step, including candidate AICs and parent/child summaries.

Value

A list containing:

path_forest

List with `frontiers` component containing models at each step.

aic_by_model

Named list of AIC values indexed by model key.

all_models

A combined data frame of all models explored across all steps, sorted by size and AIC.

meta

A list of the parameters used (`K`, `eps`, `delta`, `L`, and `family`).

Details

This function constructs a *model forest* representing multiple competitive forward-selection paths, rather than a single greedy stepwise sequence.

For each parent model: - All possible one-variable additions are evaluated. - Children that pass AIC filters (`eps` and `delta`) are retained. - Duplicates are merged by retaining the best AIC among identical variable sets.

The algorithm stops early if no parent produces an improved child.

Examples

## Linear regression example
set.seed(1)
n <- 150; p <- 8
X <- as.data.frame(matrix(rnorm(n*p), n, p))
names(X) <- paste0("x", 1:p)
beta <- c(2, -1.5, 0, 0, 1, rep(0, p-5))
y <- as.numeric(as.matrix(X) %*% beta + rnorm(n, 1))

forest <- build_paths(
  X, y,
  family = "gaussian",
  K = 10, eps = 1e-6, delta = 2, L = 100,
  verbose = TRUE
)
#> Step 0: Intercept-only AIC = 745.6120
#> 
#> --- Step 1 ---
#> Parents this step: 1
#> 
#> Parent 1: (intercept) | AIC = 745.6120
#>   Candidates (sorted by child AIC):
#>  added_var      AIC delta_from_best  kept
#>         x1 659.6131         0.00000  TRUE
#>         x2 698.0311        38.41804 FALSE
#>         x5 714.6503        55.03723 FALSE
#>         x8 745.5227        85.90965 FALSE

#> No parent improved by ≥ eps; stopping early.

## Logistic regression example
set.seed(1)
n <- 200; p <- 8
X <- as.data.frame(matrix(rnorm(n*p), n, p))
names(X) <- paste0("x", 1:p)
eta <- 1.5*X$x1 - 2*X$x2 + 1*X$x5
prob <- 1/(1 + exp(-eta))
y <- rbinom(n, 1, prob)

forest <- build_paths(
  X, y,
  family = "binomial",
  K = 10, eps = 1e-6, delta = 2, L = 100,
  verbose = TRUE
)
#> Step 0: Intercept-only AIC = 277.6367
#> 
#> --- Step 1 ---
#> Parents this step: 1
#> 
#> Parent 1: (intercept) | AIC = 277.6367
#>   Candidates (sorted by child AIC):
#>  added_var      AIC delta_from_best  kept
#>         x2 230.2056         0.00000  TRUE
#>         x1 243.6878        13.48227 FALSE
#>         x5 268.1166        37.91105 FALSE
#>         x4 278.9283        48.72273 FALSE
#>         x3 279.2604        49.05482 FALSE
#>         x7 279.4034        49.19785 FALSE
#>         x8 279.6366        49.43101 FALSE
#>         x6 279.6366        49.43108 FALSE
#> 
#> Generated 1 children (unique 1, merged 0 duplicates)
#>    Best AIC before dedup = 230.2056, Worst AIC before dedup = 230.2056
#>    Best AIC after dedup  = 230.2056, Worst AIC after dedup  = 230.2056
#> 
#> --- Step 2 ---
#> Parents this step: 1
#>
